title: Moravec's Paradox and the Robot Olympics
excerpt: By fine-tuning our latest model, we were able to solve a series of very difficult manipulation challenge tasks.

title: Emergence of Human to Robot Transfer in VLAs
π*0.6: a VLA that Learns from Experience
excerpt: A method for training our generalist policies with RL to improve success rate and throughput on real-world tasks.

title: Real-Time Action Chunking with Large Models
VLAs that Train Fast, Run Fast, and Generalize Better
π0.5: a VLA with Open-World Generalization
excerpt: Our latest generalist policy, π0.5, extends π0 and enables open-world generalization. Our new model can control a mobile manipulator to clean up an entirely new kitchen or bedroom.

title: Teaching Robots to Listen and Think Harder
Open Sourcing π0
excerpt: We are releasing the weights and code for π0 as well as our new π0-FAST autoregressive model.

title: π0: Our First Generalist Policy
excerpt: Our first generalist policy, π0, a prototype model that combines large-scale multi-task and multi-robot data collection with a new network architecture to enable the most capable and dexterous generalist robot policy to date.
